creator: administrator@netsprint.pl
text:
I was trying hard to build the newest jk 1.2.8 according to those docs but hmm -
they just don't make sense when you look at whats in
http://www.apache.org/dist/jakarta/tomcat-connectors/jk/source/jk-1.2.8/jakarta-tomcat-connectors-1.2.8-src.tar.gz

I found in README attached to the sources that it supposed to be built using
'ant' but it didn't work out for me either. I must say that docs for the jks
were and still are poor. 

Is it possible to synchro what's distributed with what's being published as docs?

creator: mturk@apache.org
text:
You are by all means right.
The docs are out of sync a little bit, but not that
much as they where before 1.2.8.

If you have been able to build the jk finally, you can write a line or two
correcting exiting docs, and I'll be more then happy to commit the updates.

Regards,
Mladen
